snippet: With thousands thought to have perished in Friday’s landslide, officials have shifted their focus toward survivors, while anguished relatives are still digging for their loved ones’ bodies.
abstract: Afghanistan officials, with 2,100 people thought to have perished in landslide, shift their focus toward survivors; anguished relatives are still digging for their loved ones’ bodies.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and HABIB ZAHORI
byline.contributor: Haris Kakar contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: With thousands thought to have perished in Friday’s landslide, officials have shifted their focus toward survivors, while anguished relatives are still digging for their loved ones’ bodies.

headline.main: Survivors’ Hopes Fade in Aftermath of Afghan Landslide
headline.print_headline: Survivors’ Hopes Fade in Aftermath of Afghan Landslide
